results.title: ‘Persuasion’ Director Thinks Jane Austen Will Be Just Fine
results.abstract: After the backlash to the trailer for her Netflix drama, Carrie Cracknell argues that the movie was made with “openhearted respect” for the author.

multimedia.caption: “There’s been no attempt to dismantle the original material,” the filmmaker Carrie Cracknell said of her new adaptation of Jane Austen.
multimedia.copyright: Rosie Marks for The New York Times

results.title: They Loved Volcanoes and Each Other
results.abstract: A new documentary examines the work and lives of the French volcanologists Katia and Maurice Krafft, helped mightily by their own magnificent footage.

multimedia.caption: The Kraffs’ relationship is also the subject of the new documentary.
The Kraffs’ relationship is also the subject of the new documentary.
The Kraffs’ relationship is also the subject of the new documentary.

results.title: Remembering James Caan and His Potent Mix of Swagger and Delicacy
results.abstract: “The Godfather” helped open up a range of roles for the actor that allowed him to play against type and expectation in wonderful ways.

multimedia.caption: James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.
James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.
James Caan’s career may have risen and fallen, but he brought a greatness to it overall.

results.title: Zawe Ashton Isn’t Here to Be a Victim of Your Projections
results.abstract: The actress was never offered a period piece until “Mr. Malcolm’s List.” She was given 24 hours to decide whether to do it. Now she’s earning raves.

multimedia.caption: “The reality is you can be acting for a long time and not be called to that table,” Zawe Ashton said of the lack of diversity in period dramas.
multimedia.copyright: Heather Sten for The New York Times

results.title: The Real Reason the Minions Have Taken Over the World
results.abstract: Wordless, antic, physical: The film franchise’s comedy is nothing like prevailing family entertainment, and that’s a good thing.

multimedia.caption: From “Minions: The Rise of Gru,” Otto, left, Stuart and Bob, all voiced by Pierre Coffin.
From “Minions: The Rise of Gru,” Otto, left, Stuart and Bob, all voiced by Pierre Coffin.

results.title: ‘Hollywood Ending,’ a Cradle-to-Jail Biography of Harvey Weinstein
results.abstract: Ken Auletta looks for Weinstein’s Rosebud in this dispiriting account of the former movie mogul’s life.
des_facet: Hollywood Ending: Harvey Weinstein and the Culture of Silence (Book)

results.title: ‘Thor: Love and Thunder’ Review: A God’s Comic Twilight
results.abstract: The director Taika Waititi injects antic silliness, once again, into this Marvel franchise starring Chris Hemsworth, who swings a mighty hammer and flexes mightier muscles.

results.title: ‘The Sea Beast’ Review: Of Monsters and Men
results.abstract: In this new animated film from Netflix, a monster hunter and an orphan become unlikely allies at sea.

multimedia.caption: In “The Sea Beast,” Jacob becomes Maisie’s unwitting comrade, but he has his own past marred by monstrosity.
In “The Sea Beast,” Jacob becomes Maisie’s unwitting comrade, but he has his own past marred by monstrosity.

results.title: 9 James Caan Movies to Stream
results.abstract: Drama, comedy, suspense, action, kids’ movies — there was truly nothing he couldn’t do. Who else could star in both “The Godfather” and “Elf”?

multimedia.caption: James Caan made a career comeback in “Misery.”
James Caan made a career comeback in “Misery.”

results.title: A Global Hit, ‘Notre Dame de Paris’ Finally Lands in New York
results.abstract: The splashy show, an example par excellence of what makes modern French musicals distinctive, begins a run at Lincoln Center.

multimedia.caption: Angelo Del Vecchio as Quasimodo and Hiba Tawaji as Esmerelda in the production of “Notre Dame de Paris” that will play at Lincoln Center.

results.title: Abubakr Ali Gets a Boost From Whale-Watching and Eid Fashions
results.abstract: As the first Arab Muslim lead in a comic book adaptation, the Egyptian American actor lists the things guiding him as he steps into the spotlight.

results.title: Beanie Feldstein to Depart ‘Funny Girl’ Earlier Than Expected
results.abstract: The actress announced on Instagram that she would be leaving the musical at the end of July, two months earlier than previously announced.

results.abstract: This month’s picks include a romantic do-over, two-minute time travelers and unwanted party guests.

results.abstract: A new film adaptation brings Pierre Choderlos de Laclos’s 1782 book to the halls of a high school in modern-day France.

results.title: ‘Fair Play’ Review: Casting a Floodlight on Invisible Labor
results.abstract: This documentary, a lucid look at household tasks based on Eve Rodsky’s best seller, pairs actionable guidance with testimony from real families.

multimedia.caption: Eve Rodsky serves as the viewer’s guide through “Fair Play,” a documentary based on her best seller.

results.title: ‘Murina’ Review: Hunting for Independence on Her Terms
results.abstract: In this coming-of-age tale set off the rugged Croatian coast, a teenage girl strives to catch elusive eels, one of the movie’s hardworking metaphors.

multimedia.caption: Gracija Filipovic stars in “Murina,” a visually striking if overly diffuse tale of an unruly daughter.

results.title: James Caan, Actor Who Won Fame in ‘The Godfather,’ Dies at 82
results.abstract: A Bronx native, he starred in countless movies and TV shows, but was most closely identified with the volatile character Sonny Corleone.

multimedia.caption: James Caan as Sonny Corleone in “The Godfather” (1972).
James Caan as Sonny Corleone in “The Godfather” (1972).
James Caan as Sonny Corleone in “The Godfather” (1972).

results.title: In ‘Living Wine’ Documentary, Natural Wine Transcends the Clichés
results.abstract: Forget funkiness. The focus here is farming, culture, the environment, climate change and, yes, great-tasting wine.

multimedia.caption: The documentary “Living Wine” traces the journeys of several natural wine growers and producers in California.
The documentary “Living Wine” traces the journeys of several natural wine growers and producers in California.
The documentary “Living Wine” traces the journeys of several natural wine growers and producers in California.

results.title: Ni Kuang, Prolific Hong Kong Novelist and Screenwriter, Dies at 87
results.abstract: Best known for fantastical thrillers that doubled as political allegories, he also wrote hundreds of martial arts films for Bruce Lee and others.

multimedia.caption: Ni Kuang in 2006 in Hong Kong. He was perhaps best known for the “Wisely” series, a collection of adventure stories about encounters with aliens and battles with intelligent monsters that sometimes contained pointed political criticism.
multimedia.copyright: Martin Chan/South China Morning Post via Getty Images

multimedia.caption: Ni Kuang in 2006 in Hong Kong. He was perhaps best known for the “Wisely” series, a collection of adventure stories about encounters with aliens and battles with intelligent monsters that sometimes contained pointed political criticism.

results.title: ‘Moon, 66 Questions’ Review: Daddy Issues
results.abstract: This elliptical drama by the Greek writer-director Jacqueline Lentzou rousingly summons the inner turmoil of a young woman who returns home to care for her ailing father.

results.title: ‘Cop Secret’ Review: Bang Bang, Kiss Kiss
results.abstract: In this Icelandic spoof of Hollywood action movies, two rival police officers make a love connection.

results.title: A Feminist, Neorealist, Communist Film, and a Plain Great Movie
results.abstract: “One Way or Another,” from 1974, is a class-conscious love story involving a macho worker and a well-to-do schoolteacher in Cuba.

results.abstract: The film historian and preservationist specializes in Black cinema and silent movies. She had been serving as the institution’s chief artistic and programming officer.

results.title: Joe Turkel, the Spectral Bartender in ‘The Shining,’ Dies at 94
results.abstract: Also memorably seen in “Blade Runner,” he was a favorite among directors looking for someone who could bring zealous professionalism to even the smallest role.

multimedia.caption: Joe Turkel in Stanley Kubrick’s “The Shining” (1980). Mr. Turkel’s ominously stoic presence shifted the film into a darker register.

results.title: What Becomes a Star Most? For Tom Cruise, It’s Control.
results.abstract: Sheer force of will is now part of his potent mix of athleticism and charisma. That combination goes a long way to explain why “Top Gun: Maverick” is a hit.
